name: lithely
content:

in a way that is typical of someone who is young, healthy, attractive, and able to move and bend smoothly: She watched him jump lithely on board the boat. Lithely, she rose to her feet and came to stand by them. See
lithe
More examplesFewer examplesShe sprang lithely to her feet.He moved lithely, carrying her with no more effort than if she'd been a baby. The goalkeeper threw himself lithely to his right.
